text: Robert Lowell Coover (February 4, 1932 â€“ October 5, 2024) was an American novelist and short story writer. He was a professor at Brown University. Coover was born in Charles City, Iowa. His works were mainly fabulation and metafiction. He was a well known supporter of electronic literature. He was a founder of the Electronic Literature Organization. Coover died at a care home in Warwick, England on October 5, 2024, at the age of 92. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2024 deaths Category:American novelists Category:American short story writers Category:Writers from Iowa Category:Academics from Iowa
title: Robert Coover
